1.content: What will the gender of your character be?
1.title: Gender

choices: Go around the house and try to enter through the back door.
11.content:
Your character is given the name of Bob.

Bob stopped at the gates of the McGowan place and gazed at the exterior of the mansion. The windows were broken, and the painting of the exterior faded from yellow to a barely visible yellow. The vines that the previous owner planted were climbing up the sides of the house. For years, he wandered who lived in this mansion, but he realized that the mansion has been abandoned for one hundred years now. The mansion was built near the Hudson Bay and used to be owned by the McGowan family.

He pushed the rusted gates open, and he walked down the eroded sidewalk to the front porch. He climbed the steps onto the porch and walked to the front door. He tried to open the door, but he found the door was locked! He banged on the door in attempt to open it. What will Bob do?
11.title: Bob's Journey Starts

choices: a zombie jumps out and tries to eat you, but a glass shard land on the zombie
a zombie jumps out and says you could of knocked
111.content: Bob throws a rock at the window and it breaks but...
111.title: the broken window

1111.content: After the zombie is hit with the glass it falls out the window. You see that you could climb through the window now. As you go to climb through there is a knock at the door. You stop and...
1111.title: Entering the Mansion

11112.content:
If there were zombies at the windows the front door seemed liked a good idea. You make your way over to the rotted old door with a dust covered knob. You reach for the knob but a voice stops you.

"I wouldn't do that if I were you." said the voice.

You turn around to see..
11112.title: ...Walk over to the front door.

choices: Blow him off and crawl back through the window
111121.content:
Bob clutches his chest, stumbling backwards and nearly having a heart attack. First a zombie then a half dead guy?

"Wh-who are you?" Bob asked.

They creepy, wrinkly old man smiled. Bob cringed st his bad teeth.

"I am Alabaster Groony the third." He replied then glared at Bob. "And you're a youngster that doesn't belong here."

Bob narrowed his eyes curiously. "Well, Mr. Third, why shouldn't I go in there? ANd what's an old man like you doing here anyways? Don't you have some coffin to go back to?"

Alabaster gave a hoars laugh. "You've got a smart mouth, kid." He grinned evillly. "I was the butler of the family who owned this mansion."

Bob blinked. "Butler...? But this place has been abandoned for one hundred years!" He crossed his arms and narrowed his eyes. "Either the mental hospital is looking for you or you really need to go back to your coffin."

Alabaster chuckled and made his way over with his walking stick. Bob backed away from him and pressed against the door, pluging his nose. He smells like a rotting carcus! Or that's his breath.

"Well, brat, you can either heed my warning and leave or listen to a story that'll turn your dreams to nightmares and push you on the brink of insanity."

Bob looked skaptical. "Like you are, old man?"
111121.title: It's a human

choices: Try to find a phone or an exit
111122.content:
Bob shouted at the top of his lungs and pressed against the doors. A large anthro spider was crouched down and staring at him, saliva dripping from it's mouth.

"Wh-what the hell are you!?" Bob shouted.

The Anthro spider chuckled. "Now that's not very nice." Then it lunged at him.

Bob quikcly dodged and jumped back through the window. First a zombie then a talking spider!? He heard glass shadder and the spider growl behind him. He ran as fast as he could, imagining the spider gaining on him as his legs thudded against the floor. He took a sharp turn and slammed into a door. The door easily opened, and then he tried to shut it before the spider could enter. It got one leg through and Bob shouted and he rammed the door closed. The anthro spider howled in pain as the leg broke off, but Bob quickly locked the door and backed away. He stood still as he listened intently for any noise. He only heard the spider crawl away. Bob sighed after a moment and fell to the ground. That was close. He almost got eaten by a spider! Well, he was in the mansion now. What to do?
111122.title: It's an anthro spider

1112.content:
A zombie jumps out and says to Bob, "You could have knocked." Bob kicks the zombie and the zombie is sent crashing through the window. He climbs in through the window and looks around. Cobwebs covered the sofa and the desk in the corner, the coffee table was littered with newspapers, and the bookshelf had so much books.

Bob made his way through the living and entered the long hallway. A light breeze brushed past him.

"If you don't leave the mansion, you will face the harsh consequences," a voice whispered.

What will Bob do? Will Bob leave, or will he stay in the mansion and face the consequences?
1112.title: A Zombie Jumps Out and Says You Could of Knocked

choices: Kick it out of The Way
112.content: Bob knocks. Still no answer. He knocks again. This time, however, the door does open, and below him is a duck. The duck is white, and it stares at Bob. "Quack," it says to him. What will Bob do?
112.title: The Duck

choices: Bob steps in and begins to explore, forgetting about the duck.
Bob vows to quit drinking, goes home and locks himself in for the night.
1121.content:
Bob can't help himself, you see. He looks down and decides that this duck is just a cute little thing. Maybe he can have it as a pet and call it "Bob the Second". He reaches down and pats the duck on the head.

"Hi there, little guy," he says, talking as if he is talking to a child. "What ever are you doing in a big place like this?"

To his surprise, the duck backs up and says in a rather loud voice, "AFFLAC!"

Then, it turns and runs back into the mansion.
___________________________________
1121.title: Bob the Second, the Duck

choices: ...the duck, inside of a giant, evil duck-shaped robot.
11211.content: "Come back, duck!" shouts Bob. Something very strange is obviously going on. Running into the mansion, he is shocked to discover...
11211.title: Bob chases after the duck.

112112.content: The duck running through a door only a few inches taller than the duck. The door shuts behind it.
112112.title: Duck size door

11212.content: Bob looks around and makes his way into a bedroom which has a bathroom attached on one side. As he's looking around he hears a splash from the bathroom and goes in to investigate. A 19-year-old girl is in the bathtub. Most of her is hidden by a huge mass of bubbles, but the tip of a blue tail is visible. Bob is shocked. Obviously despite her normal looking face she is a mermaid. What's a mermaid doing in this creepy haunted house? Just then the duck walks past him and jumps in the tub. The girl starts petting him and says to Bob. "Hello Bob. Care to get to know me better?" Bob is unsure of what to do. Should he walk away, mermaids to exist right? This isn't real. Or does he talk to her a little and try to find out what's going on here.
11212.title: Bob begins to explore, forgetting about the duck

choices: He agrees to help the mermaid princess.
112122.content: Bob's not entirely sure why this was the first thing out of his mouth, but "So that duck's yours?" She nods. As a mermaid, she's very pretty with long dark curly hair that disappeared below the bubbles. Her dark skin complimented her hair. "I admit you have me at a disadvantage." says Bob "You know my name but I don't know yours." She smiled and said in a beautiful voice "My name is Nagina, princess of the Cat Tail Kingdom. Behind this mansion is a lake which holds the entrance to my kingdom. Years ago, me and my people were friends with the family that lived here. Unfortunately, a terrible curse befell the house and it's owners. My kingdom once had grand magic. Now the close proximity to the dark curse has all but drained our magic. I am one of a few that had the strongest magic, and therefore still have a little left so I have been sent to try and end it. However I fear I may not be strong enough to do so and need your help." "I thought this family has been gone for a hundred years?" asked Bob. "How could you've known them? And second, I hate to break this to you princess, but I don't believe in magic." "As long as they spend more of their lives in water than out of, my people and I can live hundreds of years. And to your second point, do you believe in mermaids?" Before Bob can answer she decides to continue "If it convinces you, I'll show you a little magic." She touches a finger to a pearl around her neck. Her and the bubbles float to about half way up the room and moves to out of the bathtub. Bob takes a step backwards as not the get hit, and because he's a little taken a back. She rotates to a standing position as the bubbles look softer and softer. Suddenly she's standing in a white robe in front of Bob. Her tail is gone, and has been replaced with legs. She holds out her hand and blows bubbles into existence and into Bob's face. "Convinced?" she asks. Bob nods. She offers him her hand and asks "Will you help?"
112122.title: Talk with the mermaid.

1121222.content: Bob hesitates, not entirely sure what he'd be getting himself into, but agrees and takes her hand. Nagina smiles again and says "Than maybe there is still hope." She takes off the robe and hangs it over the side of the tub. She's wearing tight fitting pants that have a scale pattern on them, and a green sports bra. She led him out of the bathroom as he said "I didn't realize mermaids wore clothes." "We don't always." she replied "And it can be more fun not to, but I'm here to work not to play." "Where did the clothes come from? Were you wearing that shirt in the bathtub?" "No of course not." she answered. "It's magic. It doesn't have to make sense." Bob changes the topic away from her clothes for a minute. "What's going on with this curse anyway?" "The owner of the house was dying, but he had yet to write a will. He had three sons, all of whom wanted the house because of the lake it was next to, and none of them was going to share it with the others. What happened after that is something we need to find out. None of them ended up with ownership of the house, they all vanished, presumably dead." Just as they rounded a corner, they saw a man at the other end of a hallway. His hair was tied back in a pony tail and he wore early 20th century clothing. He was tall and definitely dead as he was floating and see-through. As he came towards them the pair noticed a roof finial sticking through his chest, like a sharp post used to decorate roofs "I know him." Said Nagina suddenly. "His name is Edward. Edward McGowan. He is, well he was the second son of the owner." She says to the ghost "Ed, it's me, Nagina." Edward seemed to ignore her and floated past them and through the wall at the end of the hallway. "He looks like he could've been murdered." notes Bob as Nagina was turning green. "But if one of his brothers killed him and the third brother, why didn't he get the house?" Just as he finished she threw up in the corner. Then she straightened up and asked "You're skeptical of mermaids, but when you see a ghost you don't blink?" "If mermaids exist then I'll believe anything." remarks Bob "Are you ok?" "Yeah fine." said Nagina sarcastically. "I just saw the murdered ghost of someone I was good friends with, but I'm perfectly fine." "Could the McGowan's do magic?" asked Bob. "No. Why do you ask?" "Well it just would've made sense, since we're looking into a curse." Nagina shook her head sending her curly hair from side-to-side. Good magic must be learned, as I learned magic. Dark magic isn't the same. Even if no one in the family could weld magic, an evil enough event could cause a curse on the house, and murder is undoubtedly evil." Suddenly Nagina could feel a strange sensation in her legs. She made a face and felt her pants which for a moment felt more like scales than cloth, before returning to normal. "Under normal circumstances it is very easy for one of my people to keep their tail as legs. With the curse draining my magic, it's taking a bit of my concentration to keep my legs, and even then... For a moment my legs started to change back to me tail. I don't know how much longer I can hold onto my legs." "Then we better hurry." says Bob. "Maybe we can learn more if we find another ghost. But where do we look?" They both think about it for a moment. They each come up with a suggestion. Bob suggests they try to find the kitchen, someone may of been poisoned. Nagina thinks they should go to the owner's bedroom to see if he finished a will that no one, or almost no one, knew about.
1121222.title: He agrees to help the mermaid princess.

11212222.content: "We can try the bedroom first." says Bob. Nagina knew where the bedrooms are so she leads Bob to the closest one. They enter the room. It has a king size bed with a candelabra on a bedside table. There is a dresser covered in dust beneath a small cracked open window. As they approach the bedside table, Nagina feels strange again. As Bob reached for the drawer in the bedside table he heard a thump on the bed. He turns around to find Nagina lying on the bed. Her clothes are gone and her tail is back. "What happened?" asks Bob. "I couldn't hold my legs any longer." replies Nagina. "I need to rest a little. I'll wait here while you're looking. Eventually I'll need to get in some water like another bathtub or something. But maybe not yet. Also, I could use something to drink. Water preferably, but I need something." "Ok." says Bob. "I'll see what I can find." He heads to the kitchen. In it he finds a gallon of water on the counter. When he picks it up, he notices a body on the floor that has a knife protruding from his chest. He takes the gallon back to the bedroom. When he returns to the bedroom Nagina is gone. Instead there is another ghost, who is looking directly at him, as if waiting for him. He doesn't look like the dead body in the kitchen so he must be the third brother. "Bob. This doesn't concern you. Leave now or die." Bob doesn't want to die, but he doesn't want to abandon the mermaid princess either. He's not sure if he should tell the ghost no, or pretend to leave.
11212222.title: Go the owner's bedroom.

112122221.content: Bob had just finished getting use to the fact all sorts of strange things existed, he wasn't going to let one push him around. "Look pal. I don't know who you are. You're probably a McGowan brother, but I'm here to help end this curse and I'm not going anywhere." The ghost grinned a scary grin and said "You are leaving. And you aren't coming back, unless it's as a ghost. And by then it will be too late. Ghosts are powerless to change a curse." The ghost approached Bob, but he stood his ground. The ghost grabbed Bob on the shoulders, which surprised him. Bob to a swing at him, but it went right through his head. "Good bye Bob." said the ghost. He flew like hurricane winds towards the window and threw Bob out it. Bob went flying and cracked his head on a tombstone. He stood up and said "That hurt a bit." Then jumped when he realized his body with the head injury was still lying on the ground and he's now transparent. "Don't tell me. I'm dead?" he asked himself.
112122221.title: Say no.

112122222.content: He decides that it might be best not to debate this with the angry ghost. "Fine." He says. He turns and walks out the door, but slips down a side hallway. After a few minutes, Bob peaked back into the bedroom and can see the ghost is gone. He walks back in. "Nagina?" He whispers. "Nagina?" He repeats a little loud. There's a rustle from under the bed and Bob jumps. Nagina pokes her head out. "Is he gone?" she asks. "You startled me." says Bob. "Yes he's gone." "Help me out of here." Nagina tells Bob. He grabs her arms and drags her out from under the bed. Once he lets go of her, she picks a cobweb from her hair. "How did you get down there? I thought you were tired" asks Bob. "I saw him coming and hid. Now that I wasn't spending any energy on legs, I was able to roll myself quickly off the bed. I was afraid he might still be dangerous." "Still?" asked Bob. "In life, he was the eldest brother. He always seemed ruthless. I suspect he killed his other two brothers for the house. But I don't know why he too is dead." "I found the other brother in the kitchen, or his body anyways. He had been stabbed. Though, come to think of it, it was as if he was killed in the last few days, not 100 years ago." says Bob. "Curses can have all sorts of effects on the time in the area. That's one of the things that make them so strange." answered Nagina. "Is that water for me?" "Yeah." says Bob giving her the gallon. "It was in the kitchen." She unscrews the gallon and takes a sip. "Mmm. This will have to do, but I wish I had more. My tail has been dry too long. It seems to be drying out faster than usual." She drinks half of it while Bob watches her. "So what do we do now?" He asked. "We must find out how the eldest brother died. If we can find the last ghost, maybe he can tell us something." "Where do we look?" Nagina didn't answer right away. Instead, she poured some of the water on her tail, or what she could reach of it anyways, since she couldn't reach the bottom half. "Do you think you could do me a favor?" she asked handing him the gallon. "And pour the water over the rest of my tail." "Um. Sure. Why not?" says Bob. He pours the water all over the end of her tail. "That feels great." says Nagina. Bob tosses the empty gallon aside. "If the brother died in the kitchen, he could still be around there somewhere. We should start there." says Nagina. Bob stands. Nagina stretches and suddenly has legs and clothes again. She too stands. "That water was refreshing. Though I'll probably need more before long. Let's go." They head out the door to the kitchen. When they get there Nagina looks at the body and sighs. "This was the youngest brother, John. He and I were friends, just not good friends." She gulps and says "Now we just need to find his ghost, assuming he has one." As if one cue, John's ghost entered the kitchen. But would he be helpful or hurtful?
112122222.title: Pretend to leave.

choices: ...an old man with a long, white beard, carrying a staff.
1122.content:
"Outta my way, stupid duck!" shouted Bob, kicking the duck.

Bob didn't know very much about waterbirds, but what happened next would surprise even an ardent member of the Audobon Society. Instead of flying through the air, as one would expect a duck to do when kicked, the duck didn't budge. Bob's foot bounced off of it, as if magically repelled.

"Whoa," thought Bob. "That's weird."

He tried touching the duck with his hand, only to have it similarly repulsed. It was like touching opposite magnets together. Curious, Bob tried kicking the duck again.

"I really wouldn't do that if I were you," spoke a voice from behind him.

Turning around, he saw...
1122.title: The marvellous magnetic duck

11221.content:
"Wha... who are you? Are you some kind of wizard?" stammered Bob.
The man did certainly look like a wizard. He was wearing a loose, bottle-green robe and a pointy, wide-brimmed hat of the same color; he had a long, white beard that went down to his knees; and he was carrying a long, wooden staff, with a luminescent green crystal on the end.
"To answer your question, no, I am not a wizard. Technically, my wizarding license was recently revoked because I tried to use my magic to turn stock bonds into gold. Lead is too expensive these days, so I decided to turn some of these useless stock bonds into something valuable. Unfortunately, I got caught, so now I'm not allowed to use any higher-level magic until my license is reinstated. In the meantime, I'm using lesser spells to protect ducks and other waterfowl, as part of my parole. Oh, and my name is Grondlefshmnir the Verdant, or Gron for short."
"Yeah... sorry for kicking the duck. I was just a bit confused. I mean, how else am I supposed to get into this mansion?"
"Oh, the mansion? Take this," replied Gron, handing Bob a key. "This is a magic key. It should unlock any door. Use it wisely. Oh, and while you're in there, could you find my car keys? I seem to have lost them, and that mansion seems to attract lost items. I'd look there myself, but I can't leave this duck unguarded, and he simply refuses to go in there."
"Sure thing. I'll let you know if I find anything."
Bob held the key up to the mansion's large door. He heard the loud *clunk* of the lock's mechanisms turning, and the door slowly creaked open.
"Well, here goes nothing," Bob said to himself as he crossed the threshold. Once inside, he saw a huge grand staircase in front of him, spiraling upwards. To his left was an ornate maple door with a valuable-looking handle. Its companion to the right was blocked by a heavy piece of fallen wood. Before he could do anything, however, the large double doors behind him slammed shut with an epic *THUD*.
His only means of egress blocked, Bob had no choice but to continue inwards...
11221.title: Bob and the ex-wizard

11222.content:
"HI, BILLY MAYS HERE WITH AN ALL-NEW PRODUCT!!!" screamed the strange, bearded man in front of Bob. He continued:
"ARE YOU TIRED OF PEOPLE KICKING YOUR DUCKS? NOT ANY MORE, WITH THE AMAZING DUCKGUARD!!! USING SPACE-AGE TECHNOLOGY, THE DUCKGUARD AUTOMATICALLY REPELS ANY ONCOMING PROJECTILES. JUST WATCH AS IT EFFORTLESSLY BLOCKS EVEN THIS GUY!!!"
With that, the frighteningly loud salesman grabbed Bob and hurled him at the duck. Just like Mr. Mays claimed, Bob bounced right off of the duck, crashing through the mansion's front door. Eager to escape the man's cacophonous sales pitch, Bob ran as fast as he could into the mansion. However, in his haste, he had gotten completely lost! Nonplussed, Bob decided to go...
11222.title: ...Billy Mays (a.k.a. "the oxiclean guy")!

choices: grabbed Frank and used him as a human shield
lunged backwards and hit his head on the wall
11223.content:
. . . his buddy Frank.

"Frank, what are you doing here?" asked Bob.

"I might ask you that same question," answered Frank with a grin.

"Why would you ask Frank what he's doing here?" Bob affected a curious expression. "You're Frank, don't you know?"

"I hate you," Frank rolled his eyes. "That sort of thing is why you always got shoved in your locker in school."

"It's not my fault people lack precision," said Bob.

"Blood! Hate! Kill! Kill! KILL!" screamed the ghost as it burst from the duck's chest and lunged at the pair. The ghost had bestial features and tattered clothes. Ribbons of torn flesh hung from its fingernails like ribbons of torn flesh hanging from a ghost's fingernails.

"AUGH!" shouted Bob and Frank as the ran blindly through the halls. They dared not look behind themselves, but the heard unholy screams pursuing them through the dark. They dove into a closet and slammed the door shut.

"This is crap," gasped Bob between gasps. "There's no such thing as ghosts!"

"Tell that to him, said Frank, pointing at the ghost as it stepped right through the solid oak door.

Bob . . .
11223.title: ...Someone Else

choices: Go around the house and try to enter through the back door.
12.content:
Your character is given the name of Anna.

Anna stopped at the gates of the McGowan place and gazed at the exterior of the mansion. The windows were broken, and the paint color faded from a yellow to a barely visible yellow. The vines that the previous owners planted climbed up the walls of the mansion. For years, she wandered who lived in this mansion, but she realized that the mansion has been abandoned for one hundred years now. The mansion was built near the Hudson Bay and used to be owned by the McGowan family.

Anna pushed the rusted gates open and walked down the eroded sidewalk to the front porch. She climbed the steps onto the porch and walked to the front door. She banged on the door in attempt to open it. The door was locked! What will Anna do?
12.title: Anna's Journey Begins

choices: Anna was amazed at the elegance of the old home.
Anna's disappointment kicked her in the chest.
121.content:
Anna wrapped her hand with her silk scarf and broke through one of the many panes of glass in the elegant French door. She knocked out the jagged pieces of glass still stuck in the wooden window frame. She slid her trembling hand through the opening and turned the deadbolt. She was in.

Before she could open the door, she collected herself. For so long she had wanted to enter this grand home and now was her time. Her mind was full of possibilities. Would it be how she imagined or far more than she had dreamed? She was sure it could not disappoint.

Anna pushed the door open and took a deep breath. Then, she barged into the foyer of the residence.
121.title: Making an Entry

choices: Look under the couch's cushions, people always hide things there.
Up the grand staircase, to look for bedroom which could hold residance names.
Through the oak door, who knows what information could lie behind a unknown door
1211.content: She had entered into some kind of entrance hall. marble columns lined either side. At the end was a grand staircase, slightly dusty, but looking ever so sturdy. The floor was made of some sort of crystal that had a rose embedded in it. Off to the left was a green couch, presumably for guests. To the right was a dark brown oak door. Above she can see a chandler with candles in it, there is a rope connecting it to a metal bracket on the wall next to the couch so it can be brought down. Anna considers what she knows about the place. It is not much. In school, her classes had been learning about some of the towns history. About 175 years ago, the land was bought by Gideon McGowan who had the mansion constructed. 5 years later, he married his beloved Agnes. The two of them had 3 children of unknown names. One of them had a child. Nothing else was known except just over 105 years ago the house was know for having a grand garden. And by 100 years ago, none of them was alive anymore. Anna wonders if there are any evidence of what happened in the house somewhere. Where should she start to look?
1211.title: Anna was amazed at the elegance of the old home.

choices: Look for a diary in the other bedrooms for answers.
Search for part I and II of the building plan?
12112.content:
Anna decides to start by looking for a bedroom. She climbs the grand staircase which creaks loudly at every step. At the top is a door which she easily pushes through to find herself in a pentagonal room. There is a room at each side, one of the sides being the door she just came through. All the doors are open. She browses through the 4 other room. In the first room, she finds a medium size room with a double bed and bare walls. Second one, has a king size bed with a candelabra on a bedside table. There is a dresser covered in dust beneath a small cracked open window. She decides to enter the second one. She looks around and opens the top draw in the bedside table. It contains a scroll and two other worn pieces of paper. She takes the scroll out and delicately unrolls it. It turns out to be the McGowan family tree. Anna spies Gideon McGowan and Agnes. As she was aware, Gideon had 3 children. There names were Homer, Felix, and Easter. Easter had married someone called Howard Phillips. Phillips became Easter's last name, and she and Howard had a son named Herbert. Anna notes that Howard's parents aren't on it, though it is the "McGowan" family. Next to each name she can see a date. Gideon had a 1819 CE next to it, Herbert had a 1866 CE. Gideon's parents had two dates, his father, Horace, being 1796 CE - 1837 CE and his mother, Priscilla, being 1798 CE - 1838 CE. However, neither Gideon, his wife, nor any of their descendants had second dates. Although Howard Phillips had two dates, 1845 CE - 1876 CE. She rolls it up and puts it aside, picking up the next piece of paper. It's the plan for the 2nd floor of the house. She can see the pentagonal room and the bedrooms off of it. All the bedrooms are roughly the same size, although the one she is in is slightly larger than the others. Written in small writing at the bottom, says Building Plan Part III. Parts I and II below. She wonders to herself, "Part III? I'm on the second floor, how is it part III? Why not part II? And the rest of the drawer is empty? Where is part I and II? Shouldn't the first and second part
be beneath Part III in the drawer." She feels the bottom of the drawer to see if there is a fake floor, there isn't. She opens second and bottom drawer, which is empty and doesn't have a fake floor either. She looks under the bedside table, a spider comes out from underneath it and Anna jumps on to the bed, startled. The spider goes under the bed. She bends off the bed and looks under the bedside table, also nothing. She falls back on the bed and thinks about what she has found. She has the family tree which gives her the names of the family, but not much else. It tells her that they all must have dead close to the same time if no one was left alive to put in their dates of death. The latest date on it is Howard's death in 1876. No one was left alive by 1914, a good 40 year gap. She wonders what happened to Howard. She thinks about the building plan, she has only part III. She needs to decide what her next move is. Should she look for a diary in the other bedrooms for answers? Or search for part I and II of the building plan?
12112.title: Up the grand staircase, to look for a bedroom

121121.content:
Anna decides that her next move should be to search another bedroom and see if she can find a diary or something that gives more information. She leaves the information on the bed and leaves the room. She enters the next door over. It was a quaint room. Smaller than she expected given what it looked like on the blue print, though she felt like a bed on one side was missing. The room had a medium size bed on the right with a bedside table, a dresser against the back wall, and a bookshelf the the right. According the the blue print, there should've been another bed on the right, but there's no way one would fit over there. Just another mystery she figures. She sits on the bed, which she regrets when it sends up a cloud of dust. She stands up coughing while the dust settled. She decides to stay standing and opened up the bedside table, which only has one drawer, though there was room for a second. Inside is two dust pieces of paper that looked like they had been ripped out of something. Anna blows them off and reads some of it though some words are more faded and aren't ledgable.

"1865 June the 6th. My love and I's wedding is planned for this . I fear father He seems upset that taking another's last name. Why does it upset him so? I don't want my marriage to burden father, I can't deny my true love. McGowans have the right to be not to be so would be an insult to the family."

Anna returns to the first room and compares it the the family tree. Homer, Felix, and Easter were born in 1840, 1842, and 1846 respectfully. Any of them could've been getting married, though only Easter is the only one shown to be married in the family. Also, the diary entry states something about the writer taking someones last name, and Easter was the only daughter. So this diary must've been Easter's, or a few pages to it anyways. What does this tell me? Anna asked herself. This must be right before Easter was to get married to Howard. She seems afraid of what her father might do, maybe because she was going to change her last name even though in those day women always took the man's last name. And she sounds worried that something would insult her family. Maybe something she was thinking about doing? This dairy gave some information. Anna thinks she might be starting to get somewhere if only she had the rest of the diary. Where should she look for the rest of it?
121121.title: Look for a diary in the other bedrooms

choices: She follows the voice to an underground passage.
1212.content:
Anna was aghast. What materialised before her was something she had never expected!

An eerie silence enveloped the dark, enormous room that smelt of seaweed. Sunlight seeped through the cracks in the collapsed wall to reveal endless cobwebs and slashed portraits of devilish figures. She shuddered in dismay as her eyes brushed over a butcher's knife that was splattered with blood!

She reluctantly bent over to pick it up when a blood-curdling cry reached her ears!
1212.title: Deciding upon her next move!

choices: Try to find a back door
Forget the door and find another window to break
12121.content:
Anna's hand froze just over the knife. She began to tremble, and after less than a few seconds she decided that it'd be better to come back with a few friends, if she was going to come back at all.

The eerie silence pressed upon her as Anna straightened up, her senses heightened by her fear. The air was frigid and foreboding, and with the hair on the back of her neck standing straight up, Anna pivoted to rush out the door.

Her mouth hung open in fear. Where she'd just walked in through the door, the door was no longer there. The broken window was also gone; just a smooth, dark wall. Tears pricked at the edge of her eyes. What's going on?

Taking a deep breath, Anna tried to remain calm. Just because the door was missing didn't mean anything. Well, actually it did, but to keep from panicking Anna surpressed it. There had to be a back door somewhere. And, if there wasn't, she could always break another window and climb out.
12121.title: Anna decides to run away.

12122.content:
Upon hearing the cries, she started walking down the hallway. There were no lights and the fact that she didn't have a flashlight didn't help her. She was careful to avoid crashing into the walls and into things on the floor. When she reached the place where the cries came from, there was no one. She started to become scared because she was in a dark mansion with nobody.

As she continued walking, she trips over a small wooden box. She bends down and opens it not knowing what lies inside. There was a red amulet in the box, which Anna picks up. Then ......
12122.title: She follows the voice to an underground passage.

choices: Find a fireplace and BURN the amulet
Try to get past the ghost(s) and get outside
121222.content:
At first Anna didn't notice the mist. She was too busy wondering why there was a wooden box holding a red amulet on the floor. And when she did see it, she didn't believe her eyes. Maybe I'm seeing things... a bit of dust could have flown in my eye while I was running down here. She rubbed her eyes. It was still there.

Standing up slowly, Anna didn't take her eyes off of the mist. It was shapeless but not formless. It was roughly in the form of a human body, as tall if not taller than her. Whether it was male or female she couldn't tell. Goosebumps rose all over her body. Taking deep breaths, Anna took a few steps back.

As she moved, the amulet swung right and left, and every time it did, the white mist seemed to jerk as if to follow its movements. Anna frowned. She held the amulet away from her body at her left side, and the mist moved at the same time. Slowly putting two and two together, Anna's face brightened. The house was haunted because the ghost was attached to the amulet! If the amulet went outside, the ghost might follow, and then the house wouldn't be haunted anymore! If she could get it that far, maybe she could get a spirit medium to help the spirit cross over!

Or she could just find someway to destroy the amulet. That way, the ghost wouldn't have to leave the house, and maybe the other ghosts in the house (if there even were any) would follow its example and leave.

She had only two things she could do: try to find a fireplace and burn the amulet, or try and bring it outside to get someone to exorcise it. Either way it was extremely dangerous, but Anna had a feeling that with the amulet gone it'd be better for all people (and ghosts) involved.
121222.title: The Amulet decision

choices: As she stepped on the outside she heard a shrill scream from inside.
Looking over her shoulder as she ran outside Anna could see the mist returning.
1212222.content:
Anna had been raised Catholic and had her crystal Rosary in it's white leather pouch in her pocket. As she reached in her pocket she gasped. She must have dropped the Rosary somewhere on the stairway.

Fear gripped her as it never had before. She had to find the Rosary it was her only way out of here unharmed. She began to inch back toward the staircase with the eerie mist following, seeming to come closer with every minute.

Anna stumbled and caught herself just before falling completely to the floor. Thump! Something had fallen out of her other pocket. Holy Water!! She had forgotten about the tiny vial of Holy Water she had gotten from the church gift shop a few Sunday's ago. She would never again forget to say her prayers.

She took the top off the Holy Water and doused it on the mist and it immediately disapated. Quickly, she turned and ran with her heart in her throat toward the top of the staircase. She wanted to find her Rosary but needed to get out of the mansion as fast as she could with the Amulet.

The amulet seemed to glow and was warm to her touch. Was this thing alive? She needed to get to Father Frank and have him exorcise it first. Maybe he would return with her to find her rosary.
1212222.title: Try to get past the ghost(s) and get outside

122.content:
Anna decided to go around the house and see if there was a back door.

She walked back down the porch steps and went around the left side of the mansion. When she reached the back it looked terrible. The grass came up to her knees; the bushes that made a fence for the small backyard were overgrown and needed pruning.

But the yard isn't what intrigued her the most. It is what she found after she had scanned the back of the house. A back door.

Anna walked over to the door and placed her hand on the rusted doorknob. She turned the knob slowly and pushed the door open.

"Success!" she whispered

She peeked in the doorway and wished she had brought a flashlight. She ran a hand over the inside wall looking for a light switch to illuminate the room. The wall was smooth to the touch, and she finally gave up. The room had no light switch.

"How can I explore this place without a light to guide me?" she asked the heavens.

"All you have to do is say let there be light," a strange voice replied from out of nowhere.

Anna stood frozen. Should she turn around? Or do as the person says?
122.title: Welcome to the Jungle

choices: Start a conversation with the creatures.
1221.content:
When Anna heard the voice, she froze. She looked around to see where the voice could have come from, but it was too dark to see anyone's face. She made up her mind to turn around and leave the mansion. No one was there except for her.

She stepped outside and closed the door. When she turned around, a bright light blinded her. Upon waking up, she knew she was in a different world. She sat up and faced the glances of a fairy and three humans. One of the humans had horns on its head, and another human had eyes that slanted to the side. She noticed the walls surrounding her and the window above her that made her feel like she was in a jail. She was sitting a couple yards away from the wooden door that served as the room's only entrance and exit.

"What happened? Where am I?" Anna asked herself.
1221.title: The Dungeon

choices: start to panic and pound on the door as hard as you can
12212.content:
Anna adverting her gaze looked toward the wooden door, solid on rusted hinges. Anna then walked purposely toward the door thinking since it’s rusted I can get out and find my way back home. Anna pushed and pulled but to her surprise the door never moved.
“Another human, thought since they had fancy schools they were the smarter ones.” The fairy said smirking.
“Another one? The voice said lazily like it just woke up.” Wonder what they’ll do to her?” The slanted eyed human said to the horned one the eyes never blinking.
Fear, nothing but fear filled Anna at those words. Taking a few deep breaths Anna decided that staying calm and getting answers was the only way to get out alive.
12212.title: Forming a plan

1222.content: Confused and very afraid, Anna did as the strange voice told her. "Let there be light!" she commanded. All of a sudden the room was alight as thousands of candles burst into flame, on the walls, hanging from the ceilings, lining the room on flimsy-looking side cabinets. Instantly she spun round, but there was no one there. It must have been her imagination. Now, there was the whole house left to explore. She turned to pick up a candle when suddenly she could have sworn she felt something tap her back. She wheeled round. Nothing but the flicker of the candles against the walls and her own elongated shadow. Now trembling, candlestick in hand, she took a few steps forward. "Show yourself!" she commanded, but no one answered. A few moments silence passed. No. Wait. Was that... footsteps? Yes, she was certain now. They were coming closer, louder, faster... and they seemed to be coming from behind that creaky door. She turned to study the door, hand resting on the dusty old knob, and slowly swung it open. Before her lay a great expanse of darkness, an unknown void. She could see nothing. It was icy cold, too, and draughty. A few steps in and her candle was extinguished. She could see nothing. What to do now? Go back and try with another candle? Take a different route? Or go ahead?
1222.title: A Candlelight Meeting for Two

choices: Anna awakens to have a child gently touching her face.
Anna awakens not remembering what had just happened.
12221.content:
The Haunted Mansion  (13+)
A story stuck in my brain. Unfinished but you are welcome to review what is written.
#1500120 by Sandy~HopeWhisperer (139)
12221.title: Explore the room.

choices: Anna goes through the door anyway.
Anna stays and talks to him.
122212.content:
Anna coughed and sat up, head aching fiercely. The metallic taste of blood lingered on her tongue. “I have to get out of here.” She said to herself, hoping the sound of her own voice might help her to calm down. It worked… barely.

The uneven wooden floor complained loudly as she stood, brushing the dust from her clothes. As far as she could tell she was standing in a basement. Small windows along the wall let in the dying rays of the setting sun. She turned and saw another door. It was small, up to her waist with a tiny brass knob. She smiled a little, thinking of a girl named Alice and white rabbits.

“You don’t intend on leaving so soon, Anna?” A deep voice rumbled from behind her. She whipped around and found herself face to face with a dark haired man around her age.

“We have many things to discuss. Besides, you don't want to go through that door, believe me. It's not pretty.” He laughed humorlessly.
122212.title: A strange meeting

info.brief_description: Once you enter the haunted mansion, strange things start to happen, like what?
info.description: You decide to enter a haunted mansion near the Hudson Bay. When you enter the mansion, strange things start to happen. You decide what will happen in the mansion and whether you'll survive or not.
